children.subject: I think I feel compelled because AI and ML appear to be increasingly important, and my peers have advised me to study these topics. My dilemma honestly originates from the fact that I'm not sure what branches are available in CS, so in a way, I have become convinced that studying AI is the most valuable. For after college, I know for sure that I won't go into research. I'm fairly interested in game design, but I guess I just don't know enough about careers in CS to say for sure. Thank you for responding!
<md>Data 100 might be a good look into the field then!</md>
If you are interested in game design, then 188 might be better. I am feeling that computer graphics (sorry I forgot the course number) should also be pretty helpful for game designs

"My dilemma honestly originates from the fact that I'm not sure what branches are available in CS, so in a way, I have become convinced that studying AI is the most valuable"

I don't know enough to give a detailed response to this, but I think peer and faculty advisors (plus the people here on Piazza) could definitely do a good job of pointing you in the direction of many other fields in CS. As you've noted, game design seems interesting you so explore that!

Also as a CS 189 TA and former Data 100 TA I think based on your background and interests, Data 100 would be a great class to take before deciding how interested you are in 189
Thank you all for the advice! I'll definitely check out advising and the courses you guys recommended!

Could you clarify what your motivation is behind taking it + what you hope to get out of it? Additionally do you know what you want to do after college? There are definitely branches of CS that require little or no ML so I don't think you should feel compelled to take the class if you don't want to. I think it's a valuable class but it's not one that everyone absolutely needs to take imo

I would second the suggestion for you to start with some of the DATA classes first. If you are more interested in the math and theory, you could follow that up with 189. However, it definitely is not necessary as we often implement algorithms and do the math behind them, where the data classes seem to tend to just have you use pre-existing implementations which is more like you would do in practice probably.

history.content:
I have seen people recommend 126 & 127 as preparations, but I have struggled in math-heavy classes so I doubt I will do that well in either. Given the description on 189's website, it seems like a mathematically complicated class as well. So far, I have enjoyed the 61ABC series and found 16B & 70 difficult. On one hand, I want to stay where I'm more comfortable and take programming-oriented classes, but I also realize math is important for CS. 

Is CS 189 useful enough for all the preparation to be worth it? I will be taking 188 next semester, should I wait until after to see if ML even interests me? Thanks.
history.subject: Is 189 worth it?
